events.summary: The atrocities unleashed on Sudan's El-Fasher last October were a "preventable human rights catastrophe", the UN rights chief said Monday, warning they now risked being repeated in Kordofan. Giving the UN Human Rights Council an update on the situation in El-Fasher, Volker Turk decried the horrific scenes after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) unleashed a "wave of intense violence", following 18 months of brutal siege.

events.title: Armed gang blows up armoured van in Italy
events.summary: In southern Italy, it's a robbery that looks like something out of an action movie. An armoured truck was attacked with explosives by an armed commando unit on a highway. The robbers posed as security guards and the attack was filmed by a stunned driver.

events.title: Savannah Guthrie says, 'We believe our mom is still out there'
events.summary: U.S. ⁠television network news host Savannah Guthrie, who said her family has reached "an hour of desperation," pleaded for the public's help on Monday in locating her elderly mother, presumed kidnapped for ransom more than a week ago from her Arizona home. Nine days into a round-the-clock search for Nancy Guthrie, 84, the Pima County Sheriff's Department said on Monday that investigators ​still had not identified "any suspects, persons of interest or vehicles connected to" her disappearance.

events.title: Kenya FM slams Russia's use of its citizens as 'cannon fodder', announces visit to Moscow
events.summary: Kenyan Foreign Minister Musalia Mudavadi announced Tuesday that he would visit Moscow in March following the deaths of Kenyans who had fallen victim to recruitment networks and were promised lucrative jobs before being sent to Ukraine's front lines.

events.title: Dating in France: A vote for love
events.summary: In this edition, we take a deep dive into dating in France. As the French government teams up with Tinder to encourage people to vote in the upcoming municipal elections, Solange Mougin takes a look not only at the youth vote in France, but also the degree to which French young people are using, but also turning away from, dating apps. While the hope of finding love remains strong for many, there is also a societal shift underway about being – and staying – single.

events.title: France calls for witnesses after 79-year-old ex-teacher charged with sexual abuse of 89 minors
events.summary: On Tuesday, the Grenoble public prosecutor's office launched an appeal for witnesses concerning a 79-year-old man suspected of aggravated rape and sexual assault committed against 89 minors in several countries between 1967 and 2022.  The suspect, former teacher Jacques Leveugle, has also confessed to the murder of his mother and aunt decades ago.

events.title: Borzou Daragahi: Trump seeks peace of JCPOA after going nuclear on Obama's Iran deal
events.summary: Peter O'Brien is pleased to welcome Iranian-American veteran journalist Borzou Daragahi, offering a deeper perspective of the geopolitics and diplomacy at play. What we’re witnessing is a last-ditch effort to avoid a military confrontation that feels dangerously close. Both Washington and Tehran have painted themselves into their respective corners. The Trump administration is under immense pressure from its political base, powerful financiers and regional allies. Meanwhile, Iran, reeling from internal unrest and isolation, has left itself exposed.

events.title: Sudan has seen 'more than a thousand days of starvation': Norwegian Refugee Council
events.summary: Charities and NGOs are urging the world to do more to prevent a looming catastrophe in Sudan. With the country in an almost three-year-long civil war, the Norwegian Refugee Council is amongst those saying the people of South Kordofan region are now at the centre of the fighting. Humanitarian groups say they can safely get aid in, if only they had the funds for that aid. In Perspective, we spoke to Mathilde Vu, Sudan Advocacy Manager for the Norwegian Refugee Council.

events.title: Failed American dream: Deportees restart their lives in Guatemala
events.summary: In the year since Donald Trump returned to the White House, more than 350,000 migrants have been deported from the United States. This report takes us to meet several of them in Guatemala. In this central American country, thousands have started to rebuild their lives after their forced removal. FRANCE 24's Andrés Suárez Jaramillo reports, with Lauren Bain.

events.title: UN says 'gravely concerned' as international outrage grows over Israel's plans for West Bank
events.summary: The United Nations chief said Monday he was "gravely concerned" Israeli plans to tighten the country's grip over the occupied West Bank as international outrage over the measures continues to grow. Earlier, Saudi Arabia and seven other Muslim-majority countries condemned the Israeli plans, which pave the way for more settlements in the occupied Palestinian territory.

events.title: Prince William asked to raise case of detained Manchester man during visit to Saudi Arabia
events.summary: The Prince of Wales has been asked to raise the case of a Manchester man detained in Saudi Arabia during his first official trip to the country.

events.title: Irish man detained for months in 'concentration camp' by ICE
events.summary: An Irishman who has been detained by ICE for five months has described the facilities as "like a modern-day concentration camp".

events.title: Hong Kong leader celebrates Jimmy Lai's sentence - as plan to enhance security law published
events.summary: The leader of Hong Kong has celebrated the 20-year jail sentence given to British pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai, saying the media tycoon had "poisoned" the city.

events.title: Lindsey Vonn reveals extent of injuries after Winter Olympics crash
events.summary: US skier Lindsey Vonn says she has "no regrets" despite confirming she needs "multiple surgeries" after suffering a leg fracture in a crash at the Winter Olympics.

events.title: Ukraine rallies Europe to block FIFA's push to end Russia's football ban
events.summary: Ukraine is gathering support from European governments to oppose FIFA's moves to end Russia's ban from international football.

events.title: 'Like the wild west': Armed gang posing as police blow up armoured vehicle in robbery attempt
events.summary: An armed gang in southern Italy posed as police and blew up an armoured van in a bid to carry out a raid, in what local media referred to as a scene out of the "wild west".

events.title: Have a baby while you still can, France to tell 29-year-olds
events.summary: All 29-year-old French citizens are to be encouraged by their government to have babies while they still can.

events.title: DNA found on gun is match to both identical twins - so who is the killer?
events.summary: Prosecutors in France have been unable to tell which of a pair of identical twins on trial for murder pulled the trigger in a fatal shooting, because DNA found on a gun is a match to them both.

events.title: Tear gas and pepper spray used on Australian protesters opposing Israeli president's visit
events.summary: Police have reportedly used pepper spray and tear gas as thousands of people held protests in Australia over the visit of Israeli president Isaac Herzog.

events.title: Face of a 'vampire': Why this man was decapitated after death
events.summary: The face of a "vampire" whose remains were posthumously mutilated to prevent them rising from the dead can be seen for the first time in more than 400 years.

events.summary: Ecuador's Attorney General's office says the mayor of Guayaquil has been arrested on charges of money laundering and tax evasion

events.summary: Juan Pablo Guanipa, an ally of Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado, has been placed under house arrest

events.title: French prosecutor searches for victims after a man is accused of abusing 89 minors over 55 years
events.summary: French authorities have revealed the identity of a 79-year-old man accused of raping and sexually assaulting 89 minors over five decades

events.title: Passenger plane in Somalia overshoots the runway into shallow seawater near the airport

events.title: EU drafts a list of concessions it says Russia must make to secure real peace in Ukraine
events.summary: The European Union is drafting a list of concessions it believes Russia must make for long-term peace to be achieved in Ukraine

events.title: UK leader Starmer averts a leadership challenge for now but remains damaged by Epstein fallout
events.summary: Keir Starmer has secured a temporary respite after fallout from the Jeffrey Epstein files threatened his leadership

events.title: US won't abandon the Philippines in fighting China at sea, Manila's envoy says
events.summary: Manila’s envoy to Washington is expressing confidence that the United States will not abandon the Philippines as it defies Beijing’s assertiveness in the disputed South China Sea — even as Donald Trump and Xi Jinping seek more direct talks to resolve t...

events.title: Plight of imprisoned Hong Kong ex-publisher Jimmy Lai evokes grief over loss of press freedoms
events.summary: Hong Kong's pro-democracy newspaper, Apple Daily, shut down nearly five years ago after a Beijing-imposed national security law took effect in 2020

events.title: South Korea will boost medical school admissions to tackle physician shortage
events.summary: South Korea plans to increase medical school admissions by over 3,340 students from 2027 to 2031 to address physician shortages

events.title: Russia thinks it can outsmart the US during Ukraine talks, intelligence chief says
events.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin shows no desire to end Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, according to a senior European intelligence official

events.title: Honda reports declining profit as Trump's tariffs and EV moves hurt Japanese automaker's results
events.summary: Honda has reported a 42% drop in profit for the nine months through December compared to a year earlier

events.title: China’s Lunar New Year travel rush begins with record 9.5 billion trips expected
events.summary: Hundreds of millions of people in China are heading to their hometowns this week for the Lunar New Year festival

events.title: Misery deepens in the West Bank as Israel provides few Palestinian work permits
events.summary: Many Palestinians in the occupied West Bank are struggling to get by after losing their permits to work inside Israel

events.title: In their words: Bangladeshis talk about the election that could redefine the nation’s future
events.summary: Bangladesh's national election is a pivotal moment for the country as voters head to the polls Thursday

events.title: Netanyahu wants Trump to demand more from Iran. The leaders will meet this week
events.summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is heading to Washington to encourage President Donald Trump to expand the scope of high-stakes nuclear talks with Iran

events.title: Meet Chile's first rugby team created inside a prison
events.summary: Chile's first prison rugby team is transforming lives at the Valparaíso Penitentiary Complex

events.title: Oil exports have been a cash cow for Russia. But revenues are dwindling, thanks to sanctions
events.summary: Oil and gas exports have been a pillar of Russia's finances throughout its nearly 4-year-old war in Ukraine

events.title: Catholic cross like no other is a beacon of unity in Olympic host city Milan

events.summary: A painting of a cherub with a face bearing a remarkable resemblance to Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni has been erased.

events.title: Taiwan-U.S. ties are 'rock-solid,' its president says, after Xi warns Trump on arms sales
events.summary: Taiwan’s relations with the United States are “rock solid,” its president said Thursday, after Chinese President Xi Jinping stressed his country’s territorial claims to the island in a call with President Donald Trump.

events.title: 'My daughters are gone': Sisters, 10 and 12, killed by Israeli fire in Gaza
events.summary: Leaning over his 12-year-old daughter's body, Rami Essam Abu Jamea kissed her cheek.

events.title: Year of the sad horse: A defective toy goes viral in China — and sums up a nation's mood
events.summary: As China prepares for the Lunar New Year, which will usher in the Year of the Horse, an unlikely mascot is trotting into the spotlight.

events.title: Trump and Colombia's Gustavo Petro strike positive tone after a year of sniping at each other
events.summary: The two leaders have often clashed since Trump returned to office, including after the U.S. seized Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro. But their White House meeting appeared to go well.

events.title: U.S. military shoots down Iranian drone that approached aircraft carrier
events.summary: American forces shot down an Iranian drone Tuesday as it “aggressively” approached the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea and appeared to have “unclear intent,” U.S.
